title: Has lateral thinking developed by Edward de Bono ever helped you? How? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes. My job for many years was “Come up with new ideas!” (note rhyme and scansion!). And I met E de B a few times. His contribution to the creativity business (a huge wealth generator) was to make it respectable (he wore a pin-stripe suit, like a banker) by giving it a scientific basis (he had a medical background) and by, in his books and teaching, systematising it. So I benefited from his advocacy of my business. The technique he mentions that I have used occasionally is the random stimulus, or input. For example, when stuck in the search for a problem by linear means, open a book at random and force yourself to use the first word you see as part of the solution. Lateral thinking means a sideways leap out of the logical rut (worn, usually, by others).

Lateral thinking = I found It very helpful. As an author, I have to come up with unusual scenarios and topics. Have a format that generates multiple possibilities gives me the edge over other writers. The more I use the suggested techniques, the more beneficial the practice.

Lateral thinking is inherent in humor specifically is joke construction but being able to adjust one’s perspective or meta position, open new doors intuitively. The theory of relativity was conceived in such a manner, not on a chalkboard, but in. the mind.
